      • parseDate

        public static java.util.Calendar parseDate(java.lang.String date,
                           java.lang.String dateFormat,
                           java.util.TimeZone timeZone)
                                    throws java.text.ParseException
        Converts the given date to the user's timezone.
        Parameters:
        date - date in string format.
        dateFormat - date format.
        Returns:
        Calendar object.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException -

        Example :
           BuiltUtil.parseDate(dateString, "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ", TimeZone.getTimeZone("GMT"));

      • compareDates

        public static long compareDates(java.util.Date dateOne,
                java.util.Date dateTwo,
                BuiltUtil.DateComapareType type)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides date difference between the two given dates.
        difference provided into BuiltUtil.DateComapareType which will be specified.
        Parameters:
        dateOne - Date object.
        dateTwo - Date object .
        type - BuiltUtil.DateComapareType object to specify date Comparison type.
        Returns:
        Long value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

        Example :
            Date todayDate = new Date();
    Date date = new Date(System.currentTimeMillis());

    BuiltUtil.compareDates(todayDate, date, BuiltUtil.DateComapareType.MINUTES);

      • formatDateInWeek

        public static java.lang.String formatDateInWeek(java.lang.String date)
                                         throws java.text.ParseException
        Provide the difference between the given date and the current date.
        The format of the given should be "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ"
        Parameters:
        date - date.
        Returns:
        date string.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - Thrown when the string being parsed is not in the correct form.

        Example :
        
    BuiltUtil.formatDateInWeek("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ");

      • isTablet

        public static boolean isTablet(android.content.Context context)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks whether the device type is phone/tablet. Returns true if the device is tablet; else, return false.
        Parameters:
        context - application context.
        Returns:
        true/false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -

        Example :
         boolean isTablet =  BuiltUtil.isTablet(context);

      • isSdPresent

        public static boolean isSdPresent()
        Checks whether SDcard is present or not.
        It will be used to check if media is present and mounted at its mount point with read/write access. Returns true if media is present and mounted; else, returns false.
        Returns:
        true/false

        Example :
         boolean isSdcardPresent =  BuiltUtil.isSdPresent();
